Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jaybee575
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite small, on five floors, with a spiral staircase that may be tricky for some. There is a lift so no problems should arise - there were none for us. We booked through Expedia with no problems. In fact the price was nearly one hundred pounds less, including Eurostar tickets ( for two ), than if we had booked independently. Our room, on the 4th floor, was large by Paris standards. Sevice was very good with the room attended to every day. We overlooked the busy, noisy street so got a good flavour of the neighbourhood. This a very good hotel within easy walking of many attractions. Recommend the Batobus two day pass to aid seeing the area.

Reviews.Title: “Definetely not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ka a
Reviews.Content: We reserved and stayed in of the "privilege'' room (superior, junior suite with a sitting area) and there was nothing priviliged about it. The room (24) was very dark and almost no sunlight reaches it: it does have two small windows but each of them has an opposing wall not 5 meters away. The TV is in the ''sitting area'' which is off to the side of the bed which means you can't watch TV from bed. We could have lived with both of these things were it not for the multiple hairs (from head and other areas) that we noticed as we entered the bathroom: on the walls, sink, door...unsightly and disgusting. I called the front desk to complain about the situation: they said they would send their cleaning lady (fair enough) as soon as we stepped out which we did, not 15 min later. Upon return 3 hours later, we found a nice note on our bed apologizing for the inconvenience. The note was on the bed and the hairs (all of them) were still in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: NeenaL
Reviews.Content: We booked through expedia. The hotel was perfectly situated with the Louvre in walking distance. Lots of cafes, bars and restaurants nearby too. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Lovely Atmosphere. Comforable bed with clean crisp bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Dfeingold623
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia and price was amazing. We were upgraded to the junior suite that had a sitting area. Room for both of us to do yoga at the same time. And bed was huge and bedding great. Out of three front desk people two had great English and very helpful. One had limited English and not as helpful. Location was great!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It is very convenient to go anywhere in Paris. Good Japanese restaurants around the hotel and shopping will be perfect for season sales. Also, there are many valuable museums to visit. When you go back to airport, you can just take Roissy bus from Opera.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beazley_A80
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a delight for a number of reasons. It is in a great spot to see many of the sights of Paris - particulalrly for first time visitors to this city who need to orient themselves. The rooms are a good size, as is the bathroom, and very quiet. Some, like ours, have windows that open on to an internal courtyard which has a great view of the local rooflines - very Parisian. The staff are very polite and helpful but unobtrusive. Best of all is the value! A great price in what is often a very expensive city. We won't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Small, quiet hotel but beware of cell phone connections !!!”
Reviews.Author: asia_traveler_2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is excellent: at walking distance from Place Vendome, very close to Les Tuileries and Le Louvre. The Mercure is a tiny hotel with no more than 20 rooms. It is quite elegantly decorated, especially compared to other Mercure properties. I was surprised by the room size which was rather large by Paris and Mercure hotels standards, maybe because the hotel is officially a 4-star hotel. It offers standard amenities for a hotel of that category. The bathroom is also unusually large and well decorated with white and blue tiles and a slight retro touch. Staff was very helpful and serviceable. I was allowed to stay in the room after the official check-out time at no charge. Breakfast is served in a small room on the -1 floor where you access by a nice stone-walled stair. Here again service was very friendly. Because I spent some time reading a newspaper and my coffee got cold I was spontaneously offered another one. This is the kind of attention you appreciate in a hotel in France. Breakfast selection is large but newspaper selection is not large enough with business and English newspapers missing. However, there is a major downside in the hotel. I could not use my cell phone in the room as the connection was extremely poor. I mentioned the issue to the hotel manager thinking it was due to the room location. I was told that unfortunately the situation was the same not only in the whole hotel but also in the street. As I was traveling for business with many calls to place it was quite annoying. However, leaving this point aside I would not hesitate saying that the Mercure Stendhal is a very good option if you have to stay in this area of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and cost....”
Reviews.Author: DickyTraveller007
Reviews.Content: Great location and for the cost of the stay a good Paris hotel. Breakfast too expensive and lots around to sample. Good location for nice French restaurants, shopping and celeb spotting (Ritz round the corner) Staff very efficient and quite a quiet hotel. Some of the fixtures and fittings a little tired but very clean and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL CHARMING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SydneyMaisie
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here and thought that the room was fairly small but beautifully furnished with old/antique furniture. Bathroom again was small and the shower over the bath is not ideal for older people. However for the price and location the hotel was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: nikeexplore
Reviews.Content: Pleasant small hotel which is well located. Unfortunately our room did not meet our expectations. It was a small room on the top floor of the hotel. We had to move furniture around to gain access to the tiny wardrobe. The AC did not work well and we had to leave the windows open to cool the room. The staff were very nice but this did not compensate for the dissatisfaction we had with our room particularly as we paid over 200 euro per night for the room. Other reviews are much more psoitive and it may be that we drew the short straw by being placed on the 6th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Behind a discreet door, a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: cischwa
Reviews.Content: A delightful surprise awaited us in our "Chambre Privilege" on the Mercure Paris Stendahl. All you see of this hotel on the side street leading into the intersection of the Place Vendôme with the Rue de la Paix is a discreet door and two lamps, and you enter into a small reception area and lounge. The staff was helpful in unloading the luggage from our car, which we then parked in the nearby Parking Vendome. The room had a nice bathroom, a very comfortable bed, and a sitting area with TV. The only shortcoming was the number of plugs at the desk for computers, et al., readily cured by using other plugs and eventually buying an extension cord (prise) at Monoprix nearby. The location of the hotel was ideal for shopping, the Louvre, and just about everywhere. Dinner was easy to come by in the nearby Marché St. Honoré square, which is full of restaurants, including ethnic eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Merci, Mercure!”
Reviews.Author: post68
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure to land early morning in Paris and even more so to arrive a short taxi drive later at the Mercure Paris Stendhal Place Vendôme. OK it’s a long name... but the short summary is and I quote Isabelle Ganier, Hotel Manager, “Close to one of the most prestigious squares in Paris, the Place de l'Opéra, right in the center of the city, the Mercure Paris Stendhal Place Vendôme hotel offers an unbeatable location for…business and leisure trips.” I could not agree more. Having stayed on the Left Bank several years ago we moved to this side of the Seine based upon the recommendation of close friends and frequent Paris visitors. This hotel (call it a boutique property if you will) offered a delightful experience and one that made us feel close to all that we needed for a 4 day stay in this City of Lights. When choosing a diamond one considers the 4 C’s – here our choice of hotels reflected 4 more C’s that I often look for - clean, comfortable, chic and convenient. The staff could not have been more accommodating and the proximity to so many Paris landmark sites was just perfect. We had chosen a superior room with double (king size) bed. Nice sitting area, more than ample space room and a very convenient bath/shower en suite. We loved walking from the hotel to embrace Paris but it was always a comfort to return to the Mercure at the end of an enjoyable but often long day. We will return to Paris and to this delightful hotel, hopefully much sooner than later. Merci, Mercure!

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: having spent ages trying to find a central, but good value hotel, we were not disapointed! This was a lovely hotel-20 rooms, central location, but not on too busy street. Rooms good size and well equipped. Excellant breakfast, and staff were very helpful and friendly. Has no restaurant, but is near ( 2mins walk) to a good selection, and is about 5 mins walk to Seine/ Le Louvre museum. Would definatley go back to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for walking to everything.”
Reviews.Author: Mindful_Travels Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Paris a number of times and this has turned out to be one of the best two hotels we have stayed at. As always there are a couple small items, such as the bathroom fan needed dusting more often as the dust was clumping and falling off the vents. If you are over 6ft tall (as I am) I might request a lower room as I stayed on the top floor and the shower was not tall enough to have a decent shower due to the angle of the ceiling/roof. That said, I am only assuming that the shower would be taller on a lower floor. We had some trouble getting the shower hot enough in the morning. I would also recommend brushing up on your french as the majority of the front desk staff do not speak English well (I was not there upon check in and my partner did say that the person who checked him in spoke English very well). Any time during our stay that i asked a question of the staff it become more painful to try to explain what I was asking, so I gave up asking anything from the front desk. The AC did not work well and fortunately for us it cooled down at night so we could open the windows for a nice breeze. ALL THAT TO SAY. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. I loved the location as it is on a great side street. The rooms are nice. It is a pleasant hotel to stay at. Oh yea.. and you have to grab coffee or pastries from "Eric Kayser" across the street. We went there every morning for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Shame About the Aircon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Being 50m from Place Vendôme is perfect for those who want to take in the sights of the Right Bank - the Louvre, Jardin des Tuilleries, Place de la Concorde and the Champs Elysees are all within reasonable walking distance. And, of course, all of the designer shopping around the Rue Faubourg St. Honore. Size of the room was as expected for this price range in Paris and the bathroom was actually quite large. The big minus - an air-conditioning system that just wasn't up to the job. Evening outdoor temperatures in the low 30s (Celsius) seemed to completely overpower the air conditioning in the room and sleeping became an "au naturel" experience with the windows open (belated apologies to the 5th floor residents across the street).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location.”
Reviews.Author: Brad073
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice with good size room for a small hotel, Breakfast was nice for continental with scrambled eggs and bacon but in a very small restaurant only 8 seats we never had a problem as the hotel does not have that many rooms. Had some great service from the guys in reception. Hotel is in a one way street and can be a little hard to find for the first time, but being in a one way street was nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Bertierocks
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. The room was comfortable and quirky - we like to have a room with some character. Our room overlooked the street which was great during the day, but it was quite a warm room and the air conditioning wasn't working (not quite sure why - we did ask at recption, but didn't really get a straight answer!) It wasn't too much of a problem, but as we slept with the window open, we were disturbed at 5am every morning, by a delivery truck outside! I think this would be more of an issue in the summer, but perhaps the air con would be working then? Breakfast was very good - the waitress even popped out to get croissants for us as they had run out! It was great to get breakfast included in the price. Location was fantastic - couple of mins walk to the metro at Opera or Pyramides. Approx 1 mile to the Louvre so we walked more than anything else. It is so great to walk around Paris rather than spending all day below ground on the metro! Plenty of restaraunts and bars within a few minutes of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Charles_Orleans
Reviews.Content: Just around the corner from the famous jewelery shops of the Rue de la Paix and the Place Vendome, the hotel is very well situated in a quiet street. t's a short walk from the Opera metro and an ideal base for visiting Paris. Although part of the Mercure chain this is more of a boutique hotel, only 20 rooms. We booked a superior room which was a good size by Paris standards with full bathroom and separate toilet. There was also a small area with a sofa and TV and fridge with complimentary soft drinks. The only negative was that the windows looked out over a ventilation well. The room was well furnished in a traditional style and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast is served in a small stone vaulted cellar. There was a good choice but there are only 4 small tables there so at times it may be difficult to get a place. room service breakfast is also available. The hotel does not have a restaurant but there are plenty nearby. There is a good selection of mid-price places to eat about three minutes walk away in the Place du Marche St Honore. For those with more cash to splash the Michelin starred restaurants of the many nearby luxury hotels are another option. Overall a little gem, comfortable, convenient and ideal for a week-end break.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel, superb service”
Reviews.Author: Steef78
Reviews.Content: During the 2 months that I stayed in Paris, I've seen quit a few hotels and this was by far the best. The staff did every effort to make it as pleasant as possible. The rooms are quiet large with good beds. I tried to book this hotel as long as they had available rooms. After my 3rd visit, they offered me a free upgrade. Either for business of leasure, I'll go back to this hotel as soon as I'll go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, good sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: Swarf_the_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend for relaxation and a bit of sight seeing. The location is great, so close to many of the major attractions that you can walk if you want. Rooms are surprisingly large for a Paris hotel and ours had a large bathroom with a separate WC. We overlooked the street, which was very quiet, but don't expect a view (other than of buildings opposite). Room was well cleaned, with fresh linen every night; bed was comfortable - not too soft. Staff were friendy and helpful. On the downside - breakfast is expensive - go to a local cafe, you will get better value. We would stay there again, because of the location and the comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Small but central”
Reviews.Author: mtgf
Reviews.Content: Close the Place Vendome the hotel is in easy walking distance of both a number of metro stations and sites, including the Louvre and Musee d'Orangerie - It is good to be in one of these museums early. The hotel is small - 20 or so bedrooms. My room was elegantly finished. The breakfast room in the basement was small and did not have a big selection - but it was adequate and I was the only person there both mornings. Free wifi in room is a plus point.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, comfy, friendly - in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BobWritesAReview
Reviews.Content: A great location, but so quiet. Large rooms, much bigger than a typical Paris hotel room. Friendly staff and decent breakfast. Comfortable, clean, peaceful, and yet only a few minutes walk from anywhere. Would definitely recommend this - the best hotel I've ever stayed at in many trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location to die for”
Reviews.Author: Abbe123
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for 4 days in this hotel - the value for ,money and location were great. The staff were friendly and helpful - the room was clean and the bathroom was roomy and equipped with everything we needed. Breakfast was expensive but convenient - you could not beat the location surrounded by hotels that were five times as expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: AmyDunn-Coleman
Reviews.Content: We stayed for my 30th birthday for 3 nights. We got the Roissy Bus from CDG Airport to Opera for approx 9 Euros which took about 40 mins, then it was a 5 minute walk to the hotel, so convenient! My husband had requested a room upgrade but no mention was made on check in. Foyer lovely, very small as expected for a 20 room hotel! Nice little bar with a few comfy seats. Our room was room 44 on the 4th floor, which we later found out was a smoking floor (we'd booked a non smoking room), although we our room didn't smell at all of smoke so not a problem. Our room overlooked a little courtyard out the back so was very quiet, the one way street the hotel is on can be a little noisy at busy times and I'm a light sleeper so was good for me! The room was nice, very homely, decent size for Paris, with little hallway, separate WC and nice bathroom, and a huge bed! 2 bathrobes, toiletries etc all provided and were changed each day. Flat screen tv although can only get BBC World so we didn't watch it. Hotel is in a perfect location for sightseeing, about a 10 min walk to the Louvre, from where you can see the Arc de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower. We walked to all the sights from our hotel except for Sacre Couer when our feet gave in, there are 3 tube stations near the hotel so very easy to get around. Nice square near the hotel with lots of bistros and restaurants and a supermarket (out of hotel, turn left, then first right). Tabac next door. We had a fabulous relaxing stay with friendly service and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small hotel, full of character and well priced too.”
Reviews.Author: anneandchris
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights between Christmas and New Year. This is a beautiful small hotel in an old building with just 18 rooms, so it felt very personal and Parisian (small lift, narrow stairs). It may be part of a chain, but it does not feel like a chain hotel at all. Staff all very pleasant (very chatty!) and helpful. Room was comfortable but not luxurious. Well located, in a ritzy part of town - walking distance to the Louvre, the Tuileries, Opera and the big department stores. Lots of good restaurants in the local area - esp. around the place du marche saint honore. Only negative was the price of the breakfast at 17 euros was way too expensive. Try the local cafes in the street outside for a better priced choice. If you are a light sleeper, ask for a room at the back of the hotel, as the street out front wakes up early! The advertised price in the hotel was 250 euros a night, which I think is a lot for this hotel, but we paid about 100 euros a night as part of a package with Eurostar. At the price we paid, I would definitley recommend this hotel, but maybe not at 250 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Best quality/price - Charmant hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SusyPape
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfecty located in the heart of Paris, rooms are cozy and very charmant, with beautiful furniture and detailed atmosphere. Bathorooms are bigger than usual for a parisian hotel. The staff is dedicated and nice with clients. The ideal hotel to come back. The best quality/price you can find in this Parisian area. If you want more, go to Meurice.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: Parisien1933
Reviews.Content: This is no 4 stars hotel just a poor 3 stars. We stayed there 8 nights 310Euros a night. The reception is very small with a little desk and a small bar. The lift takes only 2 persons. No door man, no assistance with our luggages. On the door of our room it said "priviledge room" on entering it smelled like an ashtray, the room was dark with dark furnitures, the bathroom was tiny with a small bathtub with shower above (not very safe standing in it) the shower spray went over the floor. We opened a window, we were visited by mosqitoes, we ask that the cleaners use a spray, the response was we do not have any insectiside but we were told where to buy some. We were entitled to free soft drinks, after 2 days we asked that the fridge be replenish they gave us only water. A new coffee machine was in the room but no one knew how to operate it (we had to go to coffee shops). There are lots of better 3 Stars hotels in the vicinity and much cheaper too. At the front door there is a plaque that says "Stendhal died here" I asked you mean he lived here, no! I was told he just died here. I am nor surprised. We are members of the Accor group, we are very disappointed Mister Accor

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - You will love it!!”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneCharlie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Husband and 4 year old Daughter for 6 nights in September and we really enjoyed this Hotel. Great position, large clean rooms, friendly staff (Bonjour Michael!). They even had a small child's bed made up for us in the room when we arrived - too cute! The restaurants around the corner are fabulous (as stated in another review) and we ate there on several occasions. Within walking distance to lots of sights (even with a small child). It is sometimes hard to know which hotel to choose when there are so many to choose from, but this Hotel ticks all the boxes - highly recommended. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel at good location”
Reviews.Author: CHM1
Reviews.Content: Great and convenient location. Well appointed rooms much better than those other big name chains. Walking distance to many sights in 1er arrondissement .

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: GMUWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: This 20 room hotel is 15 seconds from the front door to the Vendome Square. The rates were superb. The staff multilingual, courteous, helpful and fun. You can have breakfast in the hotel but go around the corner to Rue de Louis LaGrand and you will find a great bistro with reasonable prices. The hotel is quiet, the drapes will block out all the sun if desired. The air conditioning works. There is a bar downstairs to supply your room. The bathtubs are a little tricky but there is plenty of hot water. A friend of mine in Paris recommended the hotel to me. It was wonderful and romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: LoonySwiss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mercure Stendhal for a couple of nights; we had booked one superior room, one double room and one for a single traveler. It was a really nice stay; the rooms are quite large for Paris,very clean. The only downside in our room was the illumination from outside, where they obviously had highlighted something on the fassade, but it didn't bother us too much. It might be difficult for you if you need pitch darkness to sleep, otherwise it's fine. Breakfast was very nice, the room being a bit on the small side, but that also isn't a big problem. The concierge was very friendly, always attentive, and we felt very safe and comfortable here. So, good choice for Paris, lovely location in one of the most expensive parts of Paris... . There's really no reason NOT to go there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Maje
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at this great hotel last weekend. It was even better than I dared to hope (based on the reviews here, I had high hopes..). I stayed with a friend and we had booked a twin room. On arrival we were upgraded to a "chambre priviligé" (suite), and it was huge by Paris standards (and large even by usual standards..). The suite was on the 1 floor and facing a sort of encapsulated little "garden" (sorry.. can`t find a better word..) It was very quiet, no traffic noise or anything. The hotel is small, only 20 rooms, and although it was fully booked, it was nice and quiet. A clean and good bathroom with good bath salts, body lotion etc. and bath robes. The staff was friendly and very service- minded. One of the night portiers even found a recommended maroccan restaurant for us and showed us on the map. They spoke excellent English and were very polite. The hotel is perfectly located in a quiet street close to the posh Place Vendome and the Opera. Many good restaurants in the neighborhood and within easy walking distance to the Louvre and other sites. The only "problem" is that the nearest metro stations (Pyramides and Opera) are not served by the RER B (local trains) that takes you to and from the airports. That means that you have to change lines, and if you have a lot/ heavy luggage it can be a little strenuous to get to and from. I am told there is a bus that goes directly from CGD to Opera, though. I didn`t try that. There is no luggage storage room, so I would`t recommend leaving any valuables in your luggage after check-out. I left my bag there, but I locked it. The staff put it in the bar area. I collected it safely some hours later. I have stayed in Paris many times, but this is one of the best hotels I`ve stayed in so far. I`m coming back!

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: ScottishSheila
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a quiet street, but very central and close to three metro stops - easy walking distance to Louvre and Seine, Opera etc. As this was our first visit to paris we used the roissy bus from CDG to Opera - not much more than train to Gare du Nord then metro to Opera BUT so easy to do and almost door to door. Dropped us at Terminal 2, door 11 - couldn't have been closer to check in! We were in room 43 on 4th floor but with a lift ; faced the street but there was no noise. Big room with lots of space - nice long bath if you have time for a soak: perfectly normal shower screen over bath. Our deal included breakfast which we enjoyed but if there on room only basis there are loads of places around for breakfast. Yes the room only seats 16 at a time but in a small establishment its not a problem Wonderful welcome from reception who looked after throughout us with ideas for places to eat, transport etc. A very quiet hidden gem with only 20 rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Theft act at Mercure Place Vendome Paris”
Reviews.Author: Sersocial
Reviews.Content: I would like to share with the tripadvisor community my complaints. With my wife we stayed at Mercure for 3 nights last Monday 23rd through Thursday 26 of March. Service was as expected for the Mercure hotels, but when we left our luggage -2cases, 1 bag and 1 backpack- at the hotel for the day, on Thursday 26th, at some point from 12:30 to 5:30PM, our backpack was searched, and our document holder –it was in the backpack- opened and searched also. All our money (900Euros, 200USD and even 40 Argentina pesos equivalent to 13USD) was stolen. The documents were left in the same spot; it looked as if someone had the time to search through things in order not to generate a direct suspicion. When we claimed the luggage at around 5:30PM, we were in the hotel for 30 minutes, used the toilet and left. We didn't search for money until next day, we did look for our passports, which were in the same place as left. When we found out of the missing we directly contacted the hotel, around 8:00AM on Friday 27th, already in Spain. The manager (Isabelle Garnier) was not there, we were asked to phone back at 9:00, which we did. The hotel’s response, was slow and lousy, the arguments used mentioned that they had no security recording system and that we couldn’t prove that the theft had happened at the hotel. We were in direct contact with all our luggage after leaving the hotel, specially with the document and money holder. We only received a presentation of the hotel to the insurance company as a reply, which is clearly unacceptable. We are back home and the pretend for us to file a Police report, which we cannot do from our Country. So far, they are leaving us with nothing. THEY TAKE ADVANTAGE OF YOU WHEN KNOWING YOU ARE LEAVING THE COUNTRY. We stayed at the Mercure as part of the accord group because we understood it was a reputable hotel chain, so far, their responses have been far from acceptable… We do expect the hotel to become responsible for something that clearly happened, specially needing time to go through things, during the stay of the bags under the Mercure supervision. I will keep this posting updated with the advances, so EVERYBODY CAN KNOW WHAT KIND OF RESPONSE MERCURE AND ACCORD PROVIDE TO THEIR GUESTS. Regards, Bautista Vermal.

Reviews.Title: “location, location”
Reviews.Author: MarkGoodl
Reviews.Content: we stayed here, for a few days city break. The hotel is generally excellent, the location is superb being only around 5 minutes walk from the opera. This made getting from the airport (CDG) easy as there is a shuttle bus that runs directly from the airport to the opera for around €8.50 per person one way. The room was very clean and well decorated, with an excellent shower and a proper bath as well. the Room was also very quite although you could hear other guests moving about a little. All the staff were very friendly and helpfull when required. As already pointed out there is a TV in the room and it only has BBC world as an english speaking, but do you really go to paris to watch TV ? one point to note, is that there is a square only a couple of minutes walk ( turn left out of the hotel and then 1st right) from the hotel with loads of bistros and resturants which seemed to offer very good french (and italian!) food. For breakfast dont use the hotel, use one of the bistros in the square, our favorite was an organic resturaunt with the most amazing breads, coffee's and jams. (its on the opposite side to the hotel). Overall i would recommend this hotel for a base for sight seeing in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Area, without the price”
Reviews.Author: fiona72
Reviews.Content: We took a taxi from Gare du Nord and asked the driver to take us to the Mercure Place Vendome, as this hotel is not actually on the Place Vendome, but on a side street (Rue Danielle Casanova), we did end up going out of our way as the street the hotel is on is one way. On arrival there were no problems checking in and we were very quickly in the (small) lift and into our room. We were on the fourth floor and there generally seems to be only four rooms per floor. The room was clean and tidy and of a good size. I think that our room was not noticably smaller than one we stayed in last year at the much more expensive Intercontinental Le Grand. Our first outing from the hotel highlighted why it was such a good choice, right near Place Vendome and the Ritz etc. Also, only a ten (or so) minute walk from the big department stores, the Opera, the Louvre and Jardin des Tuileries. The hotel is also very close to Place du Marche Saint Honore which has some good restaurants including L'Absinthe and Le Pain Quotidien. The lack of tea and coffee making facilities was a little frustrating, but at least we were always up and out quickly, making the most of our sightseeing day! We didn't use the restaurant for breakfast so can't comment there. I did find that different concierges were either super helpful, or more interested in doing their own thing, but I suppose you get that everywhere? All in all I feel that this is a superb base for touring the city and a comfortable one at that!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: zzzzzzgirl
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms (31 and 42) and stayed for 2 nights. To echo the other reviews, the location of the hotel was superb and the staff were very friendly. There are 4 rooms on each floor, number #2 and #3 face the street and are slightly louder. Room #1 faces away from the street, less loud but only has one window, which makes it a bit dark. We had a wonderful stay, but note the following: - Our "double bed" was 2 twin beds pushed together with 2 separate blankets. If you're in town for a romantic getaway, you might want to call ahead to make sure you get a real double bed. - Nice toiletries, however, only shampoos and conditioners were provided. No lotion. - The bathtub/shower has no curtain, only half of the shower is covered by a piece of glass. If you have mobility issues, it might be a challenge getting in/out of the deep tub.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jo8888
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our short stay in paris and we loved the hotel. we booked two rooms, one for us and one for our in-laws. we both loved the hotel. Both rooms were of a good size, very clean and comfortable with in room safe, well stocked mini bar and large ensuite. The staff were great, we returned back to the hotel after midnight and they were happy to still serve us drinks from the very small, but cosy bar. The hotel is only a 2 min walk to the opera metro station, 5 min walk to the louvre. overall a hotel that we would recommend to everyone and it is also located in the right area of paris

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Titiangold
Reviews.Content: Located in the 1er district of Paris, not far from l'Opera & the Roissybus from CDG stop. Although slightly more expensive than some, I cannot fault this fab hotel. Our room (42) was large with en-suite bathroom & small hallway with wardrobe & WC. Huge windows overlook the quiet Rue Danielle Casanova, although no view of the Eiffel Tower ;-) The room was cleaned every day with fresh towels, bathrobe & toiletries provided. By the way, the hairdryer in the bathroom (one of those attached to the wall) is one of the best I've ever used! The bed was large & v. comfy (required after a long day of sightseeing), there was also a tv & a mini bar - avoid unless desparate for a drink...3 fruit juices & a water = EUR20. HIghly recommend this hotel for a short stay in Paris. p.s. take your credit cards for a workout round the corner in Place Vendome at Chanel, Dior, Cartier, Tiffany etc. or just enjoy the window shopping!!
